hypothesis_content.title: Post-News Sentiment Fade on Low-Impact Events
hypothesis_content.statement: When a low-to-mid impact news event (e.g., 'How Does Sentiment Influence XRP Prices?') generates a spike in altcoin (ex: XRP) trading volume (>150% of 20-day average) and a price move >5% within 2 hours during a NEUTRAL regime, a fade (short) of that initial move will be profitable over the next 6 hours as the news is digested as non-fundamental.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In a neutral, directionless market, non-fundamental news events can trigger low-conviction, knee-jerk reactions driven by sentiment and attention. These moves often fade quickly as no new fundamental information is introduced, and liquidity reverts to prior levels.
entry_conditions: Identified news event with 'sentiment', 'analysis', or 'how does' framing (non-actionable news)
Subject asset (e.g., XRP) 2-hour volume > 150% of its 20-day average volume for that time period

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves against fade by 1.5x the initial 2-hour move magnitude

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The median return of the fade trade is negative, or the price continues in the initial news direction >60% of the time.
